items.title: Met deze voetbalpotjes kun je je vermaken tijdens kerst
items.summary: Sommigen vinden het the most wonderful time of the year , anderen hebben er niets mee. Voor hen goed nieuws: ook tijdens kerst wordt er gevoetbald. Voetbal International neemt je mee door het programma tijdens de feestdagen.

items.title: AS Roma zet vol in op Zirkzee
items.summary: De kans bestaat dat Joshua Zirkzee het komende half jaar voor AS Roma speelt. De spits wil dolgraag naar die club toe, maar wacht op instemming van Manchester United.

items.title: Team Gassiev: Does 'Golden Boy' Itauma want a WBA title fight?
items.summary: Murat Gassiev's promotional team have questioned whether heavyweight 'Golden Boy' Moses Itauma is genuinely interested in a WBA title fight.

items.title: KNVB maakt Eredivisie-speelschema tweede seizoenshelft bekend
items.summary: De KNVB heeft het speelschema voor de tweede seizoenshelft in de Eredivisie bekendgemaakt. Daarmee is het programma nu compleet.

items.title: Slot calls tackle 'reckless'; Isak out 2 months
items.summary: Liverpool head coach Arne Slot has described the challenge from Tottenham Hotspur defender Micky van de Ven which broke Alexander Isak's leg as "reckless."

items.title: Newcastle contact refs' boss over Chelsea call
items.summary: Newcastle United have contacted referees' chief Howard Webb over the controversial decision which denied them a potentially crucial penalty against Chelsea.

items.title: Sources: Man Utd delay Zirkzee exit decision
items.summary: Manchester United are set to delay any decision on Joshua Zirkzee's future until later in the January window, sources have told ESPN.

items.summary: Man United need depth, Arsenal have to lower their average age, while you name it, Liverpool need it. What will the WSL window bring?

items.title: Op deze datums gaan Champions League en Europa League weer van start
items.summary: Na een winterslaap van ruim een maand worden in 2026 de laatste twee speelrondes in de Champions League en de Europa League afgewerkt. Onder meer PSV, Ajax, Go Ahead Eagles, FC Utrecht en Feyenoord komen nog in actie. Op deze datum worden de Europese competities hervat.

items.title: Mullins pair declared for King George showdown
items.summary: Willie Mullins looks to hold all the aces in a mouthwatering Ladbrokes King George VI Chase, as both Gaelic Warrior and Fact To File were declared in a field of eight for Kempton‚Äôs Boxing Day feature.

items.title: Oxford sack manager Gary Rowett with club in Championship relegation zone
items.summary: Rowett leaves after a year with club two points from safety Oxford have one win from their past 10 matches Oxford have sacked Gary Rowett with the club 22nd in the Championship, two points from safety. The former Birmingham, Derby, Stoke and Millwall manager was appointed on 20 December 2024 and kept the club in the second tier last season. Oxford‚Äôs chairman, Grant Ferguson, told the club‚Äôs website: ‚ÄúGary joined during a challenging period and deserves immense credit for the hard work and leadership that saw us retain our Championship status last season. However, following a disappointing run of results, we have had to take this difficult decision in the best interests of the club.‚Äù Continue reading...

items.title: 'Full circle' - Caton-Brown reflects on whirlwind Salford takeover
items.summary: Mason Caton-Brown has described spearheading Salford's recovery from rugby league oblivion as a full-circle moment wrapped up in all sorts of emotions.

Liverpool will be without their record ¬£125m signing ‚Äúfor a couple of months‚Äù, Slot confirmed on Tuesday, after he was injured while scoring in the team‚Äôs 2-1 win at Tottenham on Saturday. Isak had surgery on Monday to repair an ankle injury that includes a fractured fibula. Continue reading...

items.title: Oxford sack Rowett after one win in 10 games

items.title: Isak facing two months out after 'reckless' tackle - Slot
items.summary: Liverpool manager Arne Slot says Alexander Isak faces "a couple of months" out injured after a "reckless" challenge by Tottenham defender Micky van de Ven.
